rules.natural: If the Compliance Officer monitors compliance, then should the Platform comply with Data Privacy Law, the Platform operates legally.
Either the Compliance Officer monitors compliance or the External Auditor audits the system.
Provided that the External Auditor audits the system, then if the Platform complies with Data Privacy Law, the Platform operates legally.
When the Platform violates regulation, the Platform receives a penalty.
The Regulatory Body finds a violation if the Regulatory Body initiates investigation.
Either the Regulatory Body initiates investigation or the Platform does not violate regulation.
If the Regulatory Body suspends license, then either the Regulatory Body issues a fine or the Regulatory Body does not initiate investigation.
The Platform appeals the decision only if the Regulatory Body suspends license.
Provided that the Platform Legal Team files an appeal, then if the Platform does not operate legally, the Platform restores service.
Either the Platform Legal Team files an appeal or the Platform Legal Team submits evidence.
The Platform Legal Team submits evidence only if the Legal Counsel presents the case.
The Legal Counsel gathers evidence provided that the Legal Counsel presents the case.
If the Legal Counsel wins the appeal, then should the Platform not operate legally, the Platform restores service.
The Legal Counsel wins the appeal if the Legal Counsel prepares documentation.
The Legal Counsel prepares documentation when the Legal Counsel gathers evidence.
Either the Platform terminates the Compliance Manager employee or the Regulatory Body does not initiate investigation.
When the Platform restructures the Compliance Department team, the Platform hires the Security Firm consultant.
Either the Regulatory Body extends the deadline or if the Platform terminates the Compliance Manager employee, then the Platform restructures the Compliance Department team.

If the Government Agency submits a proposal, then provided that it is not the case that the Platform does not operate legally leading to the Platform receiving funding, the Platform does not pass audit.
Either the Government Agency submits a proposal or the Regulatory Body reviews the proposal.
The Platform does not violate regulation if the Platform demonstrates compliance.
Either the Platform requests a hearing or the Platform demonstrates compliance.
The Regulatory Body does not find a violation when the Regulatory Body issues a warning.
Either the Regulatory Body renews the license or the Regulatory Body does not close the case.
The Regulatory Body requests changes when the Regulatory Body reviews the proposal.
Provided that the Regulatory Body requests changes, then if the Platform not operating legally does not lead to the Platform receiving funding, the Platform does not pass audit.
The Platform operates legally if the Platform implements the Authentication Module feature.
Either the Platform implements the Authentication Module feature or the Platform deploys the Security Patch update.
If the QA Team tests the Authorization System component, then should the Platform deploy the Security Patch update, the Platform operates legally.
The QA Team tests the Authorization System component if the QA Lead approves the Authorization System test.
Should it not be the case that the Platform violating regulation leads to the Platform not receiving a penalty, then the Platform faces a lawsuit.
If it is not true that the Regulatory Body initiating investigation results in the Regulatory Body issuing a warning, then the Regulatory Body closes the case.
Provided that the Platform not operating legally does not lead to the Platform receiving funding, then the Platform passes audit.
The Platform accepts penalty if the Platform does not appeal the decision.
The Platform violates regulation if the Platform does not operate legally.
The Platform does not receive funding if the Platform does not operate legally.
The Platform does not restore service when the Platform does not operate legally.
